intro: Eleocharis palustris var. lindbergii, commonly known as the Lindberg's spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, clustered spikelets that produce minute flowers. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, thriving in marshes, pond margins, and other wet habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
